inn1.comm: pushed forward to a good length delivery angling across him from over the wicket, the ball thuds off his pad and goes behind point, a bit of bat on that too
urgent running between the wickets, Anamul jumps back and pushes the ball gently towards mid-on, the fielder is a bit deep
defended on the front foot on the off side
too full around off stump, Tamim eases on to the front foot and drives through cover
once again the calling is good and the running quick, Tamim came forward and placed the ball into the covers with a soft push
gets behind the line and defends back to the bowler
good length around middle and off, Tamim defends from his crease. I haven't seen much in the pitch for the bowlers so far
short of a length outside off stump, left alone by the batsman
pitches fuller just outside off and there's seam and bounce away from the left-hander as Tamim lets it pass
beaten! And comprehensively so, Tamim pushes forward and the ball whizzes past his outside edge, extra bounce
played to fine leg for a double
left alone outside off stump
a full ball outside off, Anamul pushes forward but is beaten, played inside the line
Roach gets the ball to seam away a touch from a good length, Anamul pushes away from his body and is beaten
shorter length and wide outside off, left alone this time
short of a length with lift outside off, Anamul stays back and shoulders arms
full but the line is a bit wide outside off stump, easy leave for Anamul
a low full toss and Anamul drives it through cover, not timed all that well
clips this one behind square to the fielder at deep square leg for a single
gets on top of this one from Rampaul, who provides a little extra bounce outside off, as this is caressed away square off the wicket
decides to leave this one just outside off. Excellent line and length from Rampaul here as he gets a touch of inswing which carries to the keeper
gets solidly behind this back of a length delivery on and around off
once again on the front foot as this one is defended with soft hands to the leg side
reaches out to this overpitched delivery just outside the off stump. Defended away to the off side by Tamim to end the over
Anamul drives to cover but doesn't beat the field
Roach fires this one just inside of the "wide" line, Anamul is happy to just have a look at it as it carries to the keeper
too full on the pads from Roach as Anamul is able to time this beautifully away with a clip just in front of square that doesn't carry all the way to the boundary
this one just sliding down the leg side as the umpire calls a wide, despite a desperate plea from Roach
gets forward to drive this elegantly through the off side for a couple. Overpitched from Roach and he gets the treatment
better line and length, with some bounce on offer, just outside off stump as Anamul allows this through to the keeper
gets forward to defend this one to the leg side
short one from Rampaul which climbs high over Tamim's head as this one is immediately wided by the umpire
better from Rampaul as Tamim edges forward to defend this with a straight bat
clipped off the pads but finds the fielder at square leg straightaway to end any chances of a quick single
this one rises off a back of a length just outside off as Tamim gets bat on ball to play this away to the off side
defended authoritatively by Tamim back to the bowler
short from Rampaul again and this time Tamim is onto it in a flash as he gets into position quickly to pull this behind square, beating the fielder at deep fine leg to the boundary
plays this with soft hands to eke out a quick single to retain strike for the next over
and straightaway on target as he gets this in the blockhole, which Tamim safely negotiates

overpitched from Holder and he is punished as Tamim times this one beautifully to drive this through long off for a boundary. The fielder had no chance as Tamim allowed for the ball to come to him, and didn't look to do anything fancy
sensibly lets the next ball outside off through to the keeper
length on and around off as Tamim blocks this one back to the bowler
angles his blade to work this one just outside off down to third man for a single
angling down the leg side as Anamul is unable to get anything on it, with the umpire subsequently calling a wide
full from Holder just around off stump as this is defended away to the leg side
back of a length on the pads as Tamim plays this away to the leg side
this was quite short of length, but didn't seem to extract much bounce as this is deflected away by Tamim
continues to bowl a fruitful length on and around off as Tamim gets behind this solidly
defended on the front foot, that was a good length ball
short of a length outside off, defended on the back foot
gets behind the line once again to defend
good length angling into off stump from over the wicket, Anamul is steady as he defends from his crease
well left outside off, Anamul watches it closely and decides not to play away from his body
a straighter line but Anamul is right behind it as he defends on the back foot
short ball and anamul hooks, falls well short of the fielder at long leg
ordinary line, on the hips, Tamim stays in his crease and tucks it away
gets on his toes to ride the bounce and plays a short of a length delivery down on the off side
on the front foot once again to defend this length ball from Rampaul
clips this one off the pads down to square leg as Tamim is able to sneak two runs
Tamim looking to drive this fuller one through the off side, but instead hits this one to the leg side for none

dropped Kieron Pollard almost pulls off a spectacular catch near short leg as Tamim rocks back to pull this fiercely through midwicket, but Pollard is able to pounce on it, but is unable to snag the chance. You expect him to take those more times than not
this one is too short from the bowler as the umpire calls a wide
again bowls a shorter length as Tamim has all day to get back to pull this one to deep square leg
heading down the leg side as Rampaul struggles to get his line right
full and just outside off as Anamul decides to let this one through to the keeper
drives this one straight to the man at mid off
length ball just outside off which is defended carefully by Tamim to the off side
short of a length this time, angling into Tamim, as he gets behind this one comfortably
this is quite predictable from Holder as Tamim dances down the track this time to pull Holder through midwicket for a much-needed boundary. He had already made up his mind on this one.
looks to get slightly forward but then decides to defend off the back foot
gets this one to climb to a appreciable height from back of a length as Tamim decides to withdraw his bat at the last moment to let it through to the keeper. Excellent ball to finish the over
chipped gently in the air but the ball drops short of the fielder at mid-on
right in the blockhole as Anamul is able to dig this one out successfully
spearing towards the pads as Anamul shuffles over to glide this down towards fine leg
unleashes an extravagant drive through the off side, but finds the fielder at cover

gets forward to this fuller one from Roach as Tamim plays it just to the left of the bowler and then sets off for a quick single, with the throw coming in at the striker's end, and Anamul making his ground in time
banged in short, Anamul was early into the pull shot, he takes a blow on his back

caught at short midwicket this time! Pollard did not catch the previous one that was a little to his right but this time the catch is straight at him and he holds it. It was a short one from Holder and Tamim pulled firmly, so that's a smart catch
and he gets off the mark with a glide through the third man region for a single
Anamul solidly behind this back of a length ball outside off
length on middle and leg which Anamul fails to get away leg side

gets this one to climb high over Anamul, who tries in vain to pull this one behind square. There is a shout for caught behind, but this was always beating Anamul. Kettlebrough signals one for the over.
ack of a length on the hips, Anamul tucks it to fine leg for a single
pushed in front of point for a risky single, Anamul had to dive at the non-striker's end and had there been a direct hit it would have been a close call
flashy shot from Kayes as he is beaten by a fuller one just outside off
full and wide from Roach as Kayes is unable to get any bat on it
similar line and length as before as Kayes is unable to get anything on it as he looks for the drive through extra-cover
this time elects to just let the ball go through to the keeper, much to the relief of the Bangladeshi dressing room I am sure

and fortune favors the brave as Kayes is teased into lofting Roach's fuller delivery over the man at mid off, just beating him as Narine mistimes his jump a little, with the ball ending up at the long off boundary after a couple of bounces
gets on top of the bounce and steers the ball to backward point
able to guide this one off the hips to deep square leg for a single
full and on and around off as Bangladesh raise their fifty in the form of a glide from Anamul towards third man
good bit of work from Roach at fine leg, Holder errs in line and drifts it down leg, Anamul tickles it to fine leg, where Roach runs across, bends and saves two runs for the team
defended authoritatively by Anamul on the front foot
Anamul just opens the face to this fuller one from Holder outside off as this is worked away to the boundary, beating third man with ease
unleashes a brutal square drive to this overpitched delivery from Roach, but doesn't quite get enough on it to beat the man at the square boundary
gives Roach the charge this time as Anamul lofts this over mid on, but doesn't quite have the timing on it for it to get away to the boundary
falls over slightly as he plays this one, with the ball popping up momentarily to the leg side
on the back foot straightaway to this length ball just outside off
length angling in outside off as Anamul defends this away

no first slip in place as Anamul simply works this one away through the vacant gap to the third man boundary. Bravo should look at shoring up this area of the field as Bangladesh are finding some useful runs through this region
Kayes flashes, and flashes hard at a full and wide ball outside off stump, swishes over the top of it and is beaten
length is a bit shorter outside off and Kayes stays back and steers behind point
too straight, strays on to the pads and Anamul glances to fine leg
a full ball wide outside off stump, Kayes comes forward to square drive but doesn't beat point
that's a risky, risky run. Kayes pushed it to short cover and ran, Holder swooped on the ball and under-armed it at the striker's end, direct hit and he was gone
a no-ball but it is not for a front-foot offence, there are not enough people in the circle. That was defended by the batsman

drama in Grenada! Anamul might have thought it was a free hit because he charged down the pitch and slogged the ball to deep midwicket. The single was easy, the second was easy, but the wasn't so straightforward. The batsmen began to run the third and then they collided in the middle of the pitch. Kayes scrambled to try and make it but he was well short at the time the stumps were broken by Ramdin. The collision took place somewhere near short midwicket, that is ridiculous running, both batsmen might have been watching the ball.
nudged off the pads towards square leg
short ball with width outside off stump, the batsman goes back and cuts hard, finds the gap and collects four
played to midwicket
Shamsur plays down the wrong line but is beaten
beaten outside the off stump
that is the doosra, Shamsur edges it and it is dropped at first slip. The ball carried to the substitute Darren Sammy at around ankle height, and at a comfortable pace
not sure whether he was ducking or pulling, Amanul made some sort of contact in the end and played it to deep square
that short ball is wide down leg side
good length outside off, left alone
played towards mid off
tries to hook but the delivery was a slower bouncer and he played far too early
a bit too straight from Bravo, nudged off the pads towards fine leg
tucked off the pads behind square once again
beaten outside the off stump, Narine is zipping them away from the right-hander
the offbreak this time, Shamsur defends on the leg side
drifts on to leg stump and Shamsur is able to reach forward and nudge in front of square leg
that's the one that goes the other way and Anamul did not really know that, was squared up in his crease and beaten, hit the batsman on the thigh
beaten outside the off stump once again
Anamul isn't picking Narine, another ball spins away from the right-hander and past the bat

I thought that appeal was initially to persuade the umpire not to call a wide down leg side but it looks like Shamsur has tickled an ordinary delivery straight to Ramdin. Umpire Kettleborough took an age to raise his finger. The delivery from Bravo was fairly innocuous, on a length and sliding down leg, the batsman should have glanced that for four
Was Bravo trying to get lucky again? A fuller length down leg side and the line is wider this time. Mushfiqur misses the glance
short of a length outside off, steered towards third man
Anamul was not in control of that hook, but the top edge flew to the fine-leg boundary. Bravo bounced him but the length was a bit too short

another appeal for a catch down the leg side but this time umpire Kettleborough says not out. No wide called so it has hit something. Anamul tried to glance one off his hips but missed. I can't really tell if that was bat or thigh pad
another one down leg side, so this looks like it's a trap from Bravo. This time it does not work
fuller and straighter, Anamul gets behind the line and defends
full and straight once again, a bit slower this time, Mushfiqur defends on the front foot
Mushfiqir sets off for a single after Anamul dabs towards square leg, but the batsman sends him back
and the ball flies quickly and just wide of that second slip, Anamul played the one that spins away from him uppishly but firmly
another one that spins the other way, played off the back foot towards point
defended back to the bowler from the crease
that's a pre-meditated paddle, took that from outside off stump and mis-timed it close on the leg side
pitches outside off and spins away from Anamul, the line is wider so it is easier for the batsman to wait in his crease and dab it past the slips
slants towards the leg side again, played off the pads to square leg
a bouncer from Bravo and the batsman ducks under it
short of a length and straight, the batsman rides the bounce and nudges the ball towards square leg
good length, angling into the right-hander from over the wicket, defended from the crease
a slower ball outside off stump, Mushfiqur moves forward and towards the line before opening the face to steer to third man
Anamul takes his bottom hand off his bat to drop it close on the off side and he begins to set off, "NO!" screams Mushfiqur nice and early because Bravo had got to the ball in a flash
worked off the pads towards fine leg for a single
a fuller ball outside off stump, Anamul reaches for it on the front foot and pushes towards wide long-off, they run quickly for the second
spins into the batsman's pads and he nudges it behind square
Mushfiqur goes deep into his crease to play the ball off the pitch, as it cuts sharply and quickly away from him, dabbed it on the off side
defended on the back foot on the off sid eonce again
pitches outside off and goes away from Mushfiqur, who goes back and blocks
digs it in short of a length, Anamul gets on top of the bounce and plays it down on the leg side
a fuller length on the batsman's pads, Mushfiqur tries to glance but makes no contact, gets a leg bye though
short of a length and straight, a bit too short I think, Anamul has plenty of time to roll his wrists and pull along the ground behind square
a fuller and slower ball outside off, not well disguised though, Mushfiqur comes forward and pushes it to point
short of a length angling into the right-hander, Mushfiqur jumps back and opens the face to steer to third man
fuller and slower, Anamul leans across and dabs to midwicket
a harmless ball with width outside off, Mushfiqur waits and cuts late towards third man
nudged off the front foot in front of square leg
bowled flat and straight, worked off the pads towards square leg
worked to midwicket where some nifty footwork from the fielder prevents the single
a bit full to go back to and the ball hits the pads as Anamul tries to go back and defend
shorter and wider outside off stump, Anamul stays in his crease and cuts through point
a length ball on a wicket to wicket line, played towards square leg for a single
a slower ball around off stump, defended on the front foot
Holder digs it in short, rips his wrist across the ball to get it to grip the pitch and bounce, Anamul plays it to square leg
a short-arm jab to deep square takes Anamul to 49
played through cover point for a single
bowled flat and straight, nudged off the pads through square
tossed up outside off, Anamul strides forward and blocks
gets to his fifty with a dab off the front foot towards point, played! Bangladesh need Anamul to go the distance here. He gets applause from the smattering of spectators at the ground
played to long on for a single
punched off the back foot towards long on

caught by a tumbling Narine behind the keeper! Down on one knee, Mushfiqur attempted the powerful sweep but top edged it. The ball lobbed directly over Ramdin's head but Narine was able to move quickly enough to his right from short fine leg and take the catch, he fell to the ground and rolled as he did so. Narine surprised me with that effort
full and on the pads, an easy flick for Anamul, giving long leg some work
short of a length outside off, cut to point
nudged off the pads once again, to square leg
a short ball angled down leg side, the batsman began to pull but bailed out of the short
a bouncer, sails harmlessly past the batsman
defended on the front foot, that was on a length and straight
he's hit that off the back foot in the air but wide of Pollard at short cover, Rampaul is not the fastest chaser
played to midwicket for a single
bowled full and straight, nudged towards midwicket again
goes back to a full ball and works it in front of square for a single
defended with a straight bat to the bowler
worked off the pads in front of square leg
short of a length and slower from Roach outside off, the batsman is beaten on the cut
a full ball outside leg stump, clipped off the boots towards long leg
goes wide of the crease and slants the ball towards off and middle, the batsman gets behind the line and defends with a straight bat
defended with a straight bat once again, the fielder from short midwicket moves to his left to collect
steps out of his crease and golf swings a length ball towards long-on
defended back to the bowler
driven to long on for a single
worked off the pads through square leg
pushed uppishly towards the non-striker, shouts of catch but it was too wide for Gayle
good length and straight, the batsman moves forward to defend on the leg side
nudged off the back foot towards square leg for a single
short of a length and slower, Mahmudullah swivels and pulls towards deep backward square leg
fuller length outside off as Anamul drives this one with soft hands towards mid off, setting off for a quick single in the process, which he makes with ease
gets behind this fuller one which is ducking into the pads as Mahmudullah works it away leg side
shorter this time outside off as Mahmudullah is able to get back and cut this away square off the wicket for a couple
too short and wide from Roach as Mahmudullah dismisses this from his presence with a lovely pull shot which flies to the midwicket boundary
tries the short one again as Mahmudullah is unable to do any better than cut this away to the the inner ring on the off side
begins with a good slower delivery on middle and off which is carefully defended by the batsman

Bravo drops the length a bit shorter, allowing for Anamul to swivel and pull this one uppishly through midwicket, just avoiding the fielder stationed at deep midwicket. Bravo not at all happy with Edwards' effort there
another slower ball outside off which is deflected away by Mahmudullah to the off side
gets forward to try and clip this one on middle and off through the leg side, but finds silly mid on instead

and he has bowled him! Bravo has produced the goods as he gets Mahmudullah playing all around this one going down the leg side, with the ball going off his thigh pad onto the leg stump. Unfortunate dismissal there for Bangladesh, but they all count
shorter one just outside off which climbs quite appreciably as Nasir Hossain gets on top of it to work it away through third man
beautifully timed on drive from Nasir as he just seems to push this one past the bowler to find its way to the long on boundary
sensibly decides to get behind this length ball from Roach which comes into him
Nasir is living a little dangerously here as he once again goes for an uppish drive which just falls short of Gayle, who dives forward, but is unable to get to it in time
shorter one from Roach which has Nasir climbing on top of it to keep it out
unable to find the gap in the inner ring as Nasir cuts this away to the off side

Narine is adamant he has got his man as he gets this to turn from outside off and crash into Anamul's pads. It looks very good on first look, but the umpire gives it not out. The West Indians call for a review, and upon second viewing it looks as if the impact is "umpire's call". This one would have gone on to hit middle and leg stump. This one did pitch outside off, lending some doubt to the umpire, and the final decision stands as not out. Unfortunately the rain has also decided to make an appearance as the groundsmen get into position for a potential rain delay.
and Narine resumes play with a lovely flighted delivery just outside which is negotiated safely
tricks him with the knuckle ball outside off which has Anamul covering for the line. Just evades the outside of the bat
tries to be cute by adjusting his stance to play a reverse paddle sweep, but is unable to get any bat on ball
flatter and on off, Anamul hangs back and blocks it to the off side
and he is able to secure a maiden over in the first over of the batting powerplay. Tosses it up on off, Anamul leans forward and works it straight to mid-wicket
length ball just outside off which is defended successfully by Nasir
slightly slower ball just outside off and swinging slightly away as Nasir gets behind it
finds the gap through square leg with a gentle clip. Looks to make it two but good fielding keeps it to one
Rampaul misses the yorker, bowls a full toss on leg-stump, Anamul does not capitalise as he clips it to deep square leg
too full on the pads from Rampaul as this is eased away to deep midwicket for a comfortable single
Rampaul unleashes a full toss heading down the pads as Anamul fails to get any meat on it to power it away. Missed a trick with that one, did Anamul.
produces the offbreak this time but the line is on the pads, nudged behind square for a single
is able to get onto the back foot to work away this one heading down the pads for a single
once again looks to nudge this off the pads, but can't find a single on the leg side
Narine drops it shorter and shifts the line more on off, as this one turns away sharply upon bouncing, with the keeper completing the take
this time he is on the back foot to work it away leg side
once again going down the pads as Anamul reaches out to get bat on it and find a single just behind square
a full ball angling into the right-hander, Anamul plays it to midwicket where the fielder makes a half stop with his boot
fuller length just outside off which is defended to Gayle at short cover
overpitched and outside off as Nasir is unable to drive this one with any authority, instead finding the man at mid off
full and on the pads as Nasir fails to get this past the fielder at mid on
another one in the blockhole as Anamul simply plays this one back to the bowler, who fields it on his follow through

on middle and leg as Anamul clips this straight to mid on, with Dwayne Bravo stationed there, and attempts the quick single, just making his ground before the return throw from Bravo at the non-striker's. Looked touch and go but Anamul makes it.
doosra outside off, zips past the groping bat of Nasir Hossain
gets forward to this one pitched on middle and leg, and works it away leg side, but for no run
tries him again with the knuckle ball, this time on a straighter line, as Nasir reads this one okay
Nasir is finally able to get the single he wanted through midwicket to this fuller one from Narine
drops the line a little shorter, with the ball turning away just outside off, as Anamul looked quite lost playing that one
gets this one on a middle and leg stump line as Anamul is beaten by the spin, with the ball crashing into the pads. Hopeful shout from the West Indians, but this was always slipping down leg
angled in on off, Nasir Hossain inches forward and pats it to the covers, Anamul looks for a risky single but has to retreat

dropped full and on the pads as this is whipped away by Nasir behind square, with deep backward point unable to get a grasp on the ball. Looks like the culprit is Darren Bravo there. He is able to get one hand on it, before palming away the chance. All of these half-chances could cost West Indies dearly
dug in short and on off, Nasir Hossain pulls it well to the deep mid wicket fence. He reaches 1000 ODI runs as well
length ball on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length and on off, Nasir Hossain stands tall and punches it to mid off

dropped short ball outside off as Anamul looks to dance down the track and loft Roach over his head, but instead almost manages to get himself out as he hits straight back to Roach, albeit low to his left, as Roach is unable to hold onto the chance
gets on the back foot to cut away this latest offering from Narine square off the wicket on the off side
pitches the ball up as Anamul gets forward to drive this towards the covers. Better line and length from Narine here
this one angling down the pads as Anamul looks to nudge it away leg side, but instead the ball clips his thigh pad onto the keeper. They go for a shout, but it is definitely hopeful at best
defended back to the bowler by Anamul
length just outside off, looks like the doosra, as Anamul is able to guide this with soft hands to the off side for a quick single
short and turning away, Nasir hangs on the back foot and punches it softly wide of covers
Nasir able to clip this fuller one from Holder down to deep midwicket for a single
short from Holder which Anamul sees quite early as he rocks back to pull him behind square. Gets enough on it for it beat deep fine leg to the boundary
seems to follow the batsman there as Anamul is looking to get more leg side. Anamul ends up playing this one away leg side, and manages to sneak a single in the process
full just outside off as Nasir directs this one to mid on for a run
angling onto the pads as Anamul is unable to get it past the man at mid on
full and on middle as Anamul ekes out a single down to deep midwicket
this one turns very sharply into Nasir upon pitching outside off. Nasir was as bamboozled as I was when this one just leapt away to the leg side. Ends up hitting him on the stomach and hand
ends up pushing this one back to the bowler
shortish on off, too close to cut, Nasir chops it in front of point
strides out to meet this one pitched outside off, as he defends it away to the leg side
bowls the big offbreak just outside off which Anamul shoulders arms too. Very well left in the end as that was mighty close to tickling timber
fires one in outside off and which turns sharply into Anamul. Ends up hitting the pads but the umpire rules it not out for pitching outside
Nasir able to guide this one to the fielder at slip before setting off for a quick single, with the non-striker making his ground in time
Anamul dances down to try and square drive this one, but finds the fielder at cover instead
full and on target as Anamul digs this one out to the leg side
fantastic yorker from Rampaul as Anamul just about manages to prevent this from disturbing the base of his stumps

this time Rampaul follows him as he notices him edging away leg side. Tests him with another full one which Anamul tries in vain to get under, but instead manages to top-edge it behind him for a fortunate boundary
finishes off the over with another fuller delivery, this time on and around off, as Anamul squeezes this out to cover point
begins his last over with another doosra just outside off, which Anamul fails to pick entirely

this time it is the off break on middle which goes off the batsman's pads, with Ramdin running around to dive and catch the rebound. They go for the shout, but the umpire is not interested as there was no bat on ball
tries him with the slider outside off which is left alone by the batsman
straying down the pads as Anamul is able to employ the sweep to good effect to find the fine leg boundary
gets behind this shorter one from Narine
and Narine ends his spell with the doosra outside off as Anamul is able to sneak a single with a push wide off the cover fielders
slants on to the pads, turned away to deep backward square leg
well struck from Nasir as he stands and delivers with a forceful drive off the back foot through mid off
full and angling down leg side as Anamul is able to whip this away leg side for one. Also enters into the 90s as a result of that last shot
Nasir content to strike this one down to the man at long off. They are both looking for the boundaries, but simply can't find the gaps just as yet
another full delivery which has to be nurdled down to the fielder stationed at long on

and West Indies finally manage to pickup a wicket as Nasir, looking to heave this over the bowler through the leg side, ends up mishitting the length delivery from Rampaul straight into the air, with Ramdin coming around to complete an easy catch. But before we get to that, the umpires are asking to check for a front foot no-ball, and it looks very tight. It would be harsh for the umpire to rule against the bowler there. But they decide all is good, and that Nasir is indeed out. He was just having a wild swing at that one, which is to be expected at this point of the innings.
slower offcutter, the batsman plays with soft hands and drops the ball in the crease, they decide against the single
another slower ball on middle and leg which Sohag just catches at the last second as he adjusts his shot to find the single on the leg side via an inside-edge
once again utilises the slower ball as Anamul glances this off the pads for one
beautifully disguised slower offcutter which has Sohag swinging for the fences
once again produces that special off cutter which simply denies the batsman any room to get the ball away. Another single taken on the leg side

this time shifts his line outside off, and full, as Anamul, batting on 92, is able to get down on one knee and hit this over midwicket, beating the fielder stationed nearby, all the way to the boundary. Moves him to 96 now.

Gazi drives the ball firmly to cover where Gayle makes the stop. There's no single on offer but Anamul has run too far down the pitch so Gazi sacrifices his wicket to let Anamul bat through to the end. Bonus there for West Indies, but a little bit too late I think.

and Anamul gets to his century with a slice through the off side which just manages to get to the boundary on the off side. What a splendid century from the young tyke as Anamul lets out a huge roar upon reaching a third ODI century. Excellent stuff from the batsman
and now he shows some ingenuity with a wonderful paddle-flick over the head of the keeper to find the boundary
Anamul looking to make room on the leg side, but Rampaul has followed him, with Anamul instead pushing this to long on
length on middle and leg which Mortaza manages to get bat on and guide through the slip region for one
dismissed to the third man fence. Dug in short on the leg-stump, Anamul reverses his hands and swats it over short third man
and, predictably, Bravo begins with a slower ball outside off which Mashrafe is too early on as he looks for the midwicket swat
slower ball on the leg-stump, Mortaza delays his pull and instead powers it to deep backward square leg. Jason Holder runs across and hauls the ball back in play before it reaches the ropes
and Mortaza is once again too early on a slower ball angling down the leg side. Anamul will be desperate to get to the other end

this time Mortaza is able to connect with one of Bravo's well-crafted slower balls, but this one was hit higher than farther, with Pollard, who is at deep midwicket, timing his run to complete the catch safely
Anamul looking for the switch hit to try and negate the angle of Bravo's slower deliveries, but fails to get any bat on it

Bravo manages to secure a fortuitous wicket as Anamul stretches out on the off side, looking to flick this one off middle stump behind square, but instead succeeds in getting himself out leg before in the process

inn2.comm: and he begins with a lovely flighted delivery just outside off which Gayle watches carefully
defends this one back to the bowler
looks to get away this one angled on the pads to the leg side, but finds the square leg fielder
strides out to meet this one on the full as this is defended away to the off side
clips this one straight to the man at silly mid on
and Gazi starts things off with a maiden as Gayle is more than content to see this one out to the off side
short of a length outside off which is defended by Edwards off the back foot
same length as before, this time angling in, as Edwards plays this one watchfully to the off side
pitches it up a bit further as Edwards is content to defend this to the leg side
gets forward slightly to defend this one to the off side
full this time from Mortaza, on middle and leg, as Edwards fails to get this past the short leg fielder
another maiden from Bangladesh as Mortaza delivers this on a length on middle and off, with Edwards getting behind it comfortably
and the West Indies are finally away, that too off the 13th delivery of the innings, as Gayle rocks back to work this one away to long on for a single
and Edwards joins his partner as he dabs a length delivery going down the pads towards fine leg for a couple
pitched short outside off as this one keeps low upon turning into Edwards, who manages to defend it away
reaches out to nurdle this one to the man at long on for a single
Gayle takes a huge stride forward to take out the malice from this Gazi delivery
once again has him reaching forward to defend
looks to get down the track before adjusting his shot to work it away leg side
goes for a rather ugly swipe, with the intention of clearing mid on, but the slower delivery has Edwards early into his shot. Completely misjudged that one

once again looking to go leg side as he is rushed into the shot, with the ball traveling to midwicket where Sohag Gazi dives to his right before picking it up and throwing it at the striker's end, where Gayle is running full tilt (not too fast in other words), and struggles to make his ground, with the throw beating him, but unluckily missing the stumps. There was no keeper in sight, which is why Gazi was left with that option solely
shortish and on off, Gayle fends it away to the leg side rather awkwardly
defended carefully by Gayle as this one carries to the fielder at mid on
back of a length and going across Gayle as he defends this one off the back foot down to mid off
beautiful line and length from Gazi as Edwards defends this one just outside off
this time pushes it off the back foot down to the man at long on for a relaxed single
this time round the wicket to Gayle as he gets forward to defend
Gayle is quite content to see out Gazi it seems as he defends once more to the off side
tries for the sweep this time, but can't beat the leg gully which has been put in place
tossed up on off, eased between extra cover and mid off for a brace
Edwards edges this one pitched outside off through the vacant slip region, with third man coming round to field the ball
on the front foot straightaway to Mortaza as this is deflected away to the off side

and Bangladesh have got their man as the pressure sustained by Mortaza and Gazi has finally paid off. Gayle, who looks like he may have just ran out of patience, decides to go into overdrive as he looks to clear the off side to a fuller ball delivered outside off. Gayle succeeds in spooning this one high over to third man, who is able to get under it and take the catch comfortably. Big blow for the West Indies as they would have been keen to have Gayle stick around for a little while longer.
Edwards able to clip this away down to deep midwicket for an easy single
Bravo is more than happy to let this length ball going across him to the keeper
back of a length on the pads as Bravo works this away leg side to bring the over to an end
uses his feet to drive this one down to the man at long on
Bravo tentative as he defends this one on the front foot. Has a slip and silly point in place, with an extra man coming on the off side
looks to create some room outside off as he looks to cut away, but just can't beat the ring
this time is able to work away the delivery to the leg side for a single
Edwards makes a good call for a single as he guides this one to mid off, setting off early enough to make his ground at the other end
Gazi floats one just outside off which Bravo is able to negotiate safely
short of a length on middle and off which is defended away by Edwards on the back foot

pitches this one just outside off, in that famous corridor of uncertainty, as Edwards looks to play a shot, rather half-heartedly, with the ball just missing the edge of the bat. No feet movement whatsoever there from Edwards, who is looking rather shaky
this time is able to get on top of this short of a length delivery pitched outside off
slower delivery wide of off stump as Edwards adjusts his shot accordingly to fend it away to the off side. Didn't really get any bat behind that
length outside off which is defended manfully by Edwards
finishes off with yet another maiden as this one targets the pads of Edwards, but he is unable to get it away on the leg side
right away he is on target as this one pitches straight on middle and leg, which Bravo is able to get behind
tossed up on off and is subsequently dead batted to the covers
Bravo on the back foot as he turns this one away to the leg side for one
surprises Edwards with one which bounces more than he expected as he ends up spooning the ball towards mid off, but there is no fielder in the vicinity to go for the chance
pitched up on off, driven to the man at cover
spins back in on off, Edwards squirts it to midwicket
back of a length and angling across Bravo as he defends this one to the off side

the first really bad delivery from Bangladesh's bowlers so far as Al-Amin overpitches outside off, which Bravo is able to get under and drive uppishly through extra-cover for a boundary. This one just blazed away to the ropes
once again in the same spot as Bravo is able to get into position quickly to drive this one down to mid off for a quick single. Looks rather energised after that boundary.
Edwards this time looking to be a bit more positive as he takes this one from outside off, looking to whip it instead through midwicket, but is unlucky to find short midwicket in the process
good length ball around off, Bravo inches forward and defends it to cover

and Al-Amin strikes in his first over as he gets Bravo to have a whiff at one just outside off, with Bravo getting an outside edge which almost seems to steer itself into Mushfiqur's waiting hands. Bravo will be kicking himself as he looked to get on after that initial boundary. Bangladesh truly on top at the moment.
Mahmudullah once again spot on as Edwards defends this to the off side
Edwards happy to just see out this latest offering
Edwards is really struggling to pick Mahmudullah as this one catches the edge of the bat before popping safely to the off side

you just knew this was going to happen eventually as Edwards' miserable stay at the crease comes to an acrimonious end as he looks to sweep Mahmudullah in front of square, but completely misses the ball entirely, as it proceeds to spin onto his stumps behind him
and Ramdin is not going to wait around as he is gets a half volley to drive in front of square for a couple
looks to create some room by rocking back but is unable to get this one past the inner ring on the off side
going down the pads as Simmons doesn't make him pay, instead working this one away to the leg side

Al-Amin strikes again as Simmons' stay ends prematurely. Al-Amin gets this one to shape away at the last second upon pitching, as the batsman looked to play away from the body. Mushfiqur is able to collect an easy take from behind as West Indies slump to 22 for 4 inside of 12 overs. A rather bleak-looking Richie Richardson looks on...
and straight away some action as Bravo is struck on the pads, albeit a little high and going leg side. Bangladesh go for the shout, but this was always missing the stumps
Bravo gets nicely on top of this shorter one outside off, as the ball rolls to the off side
full and on middle and leg as Bravo shows his class with a gentle push that beats the converging mid on and off fielders to the long on boundary
shortish length outside off which Bravo is happy to see out
looking to get this one away leg side, but fails to find the gap
this one turns in quite sharply from outside off as Ramdin is simply unable to find any space to work this
this time way down the leg side as Ramdin gets into position quickly to dismiss this rank long hop behind the deep square leg boundary with a short-arm pull
angled across from round the stumps, Ramdin waits on it before dabbing it behind point for a couple of runs
another low full toss which Ramdin gets forward to and works down to long on for one
Bravo strides out to meet this fuller one just on and around off, as he is able to drive this towards mid off for a single

it is not very often a lousy ball gets a wicket, but this is definitely one of those cases as Bravo, who really should have deposited this short ball from Al-Amin which was begging to be hit, but instead hits this straight down square leg's throat, who is not going to miss such an offering. Another soft dismissal from West Indies, and they are truly capitulating with just a quarter of the innings through
more than content to defend this length ball to the off side
Pollard off the mark with a lovely dab down to fine leg
worked off the hips by Ramdin behind square for a single
on the front foot straightaway to this length ball on middle and leg
finishes off the over with a bouncer, with the trap set at deep square and fine leg, but Pollard won't bite
starts off with a length delivery outside off which is glided down to third man for a single
shortens his length just a tad outside off, but Pollard is not looking to make a move just yet
Pollard content to stride out and defend this one on the back foot
drops his length considerably, again outside off, as Pollard can not be coaxed into having a go
this time Pollard decides to go over the top as the length is just right for him to get up and over midwicket, but not far enough for it to reach the rope
short of a length outside off as Pollard defends this one carefully to bring the over to an end
half volley outside off which Ramdin drives through extra-cover for a single
Pollard gets forward to defend this one back to the bowler
Pollard looking to be patient at the crease as he strides out to defend this one to the off side
short from Al-Amin as Pollard tucks this one away to the leg side. Sloppy fielding from the Bangladeshis affords an extra run as there was no one backing up behind the stumps at the non-striker's

too full from Al-Amin as Pollard's eyes light up at a chance to hit out. He is able to get into position to lift this one straight over the bowler to the long off boundary for a straight six. That just powered to the ropes.
banged in short on off. Pollard is able to take out much of the sting, playing the ball to the man at point
wicket to wicket line from over the wicket, defended on the front foot
goes back and nudges the ball through square leg
Pollard moves back and across to defend with a straight bat, things seem to have settled down
stays in his crease again and offers a dead bat
pushed through briskly on middle stump, Pollard nudges on the leg side and there's a bit of a mix up between the batsmen but it does not end in tears for West Indies
played to deep midwicket for a single that brings up one of the harder half-centuries West Indies have made in one-day cricket

Pollard goes after him right away, freeing his arms and slashing a length ball that had lots of width outside off stump. That was a mighty heave and the ball flew off the edge and went to the point boundary. No one in the deep there
defended from the crease with a straight bat towards the bowler
short of a length angling into the right hander from over the wicket, nudged off the hips behind square
there's width outside off again and the length is there for the cut shot, Ramdin attempts it but fails to connect.
Ramdin jumps back and dabs a short of a length ball to third man
that's a poor ball, too short, too wide and Pollard helps himself again, much more in control this time, getting on his toes and cutting the ball down in front of point for four more
dangerous to go so back to a fullish ball, Ramdin defends back to the bowler

an appeal for a run out after the fielder at short third man scores a direct hit at the striker's end. Ramdin had dabbed the ball and set off, Pollard responded and ran at full pelt. His reach saved him. A shorter man would have failed to make it
nudged off the pads towards short fine leg for a single
Ramdin on the charge now, cashes in on the width outside off stump, so much width that too. Ramdin winds up, frees his arms and launches the ball over the long-off boundary
defended on the leg side
goes back into his crease and dabs the ball through point
opened the face and steered to third man for two more
138 kph, good length and quick outside off stump, moved in a touch, Ramdin was beaten on the cut
fuller and straighter, driven to mid-off. That ball was clocked at 145.6kph, the fastest ball of the match by some distance
pace means nothing if you don't have direction, too short and too wide, Ramdin lashes it to the backward point boundary with a fierce cut
that's almost a bouncer, Ramdin tries to cut it but the ball gets big on him outside off and he is beaten. Pollard goes up to have a word with his partner
Ramdin is more measured now, gets on top of the bounce of a short of a length ball and dabs it to third man
defended back to the bowler
played off the back foot through square leg
huge appeal for lbw from Mushfiqur but Nasir indicates there was an inside edge after Pollard came forward to block
oh my word, that has gone so high and so far over the long-on boundary, an 89-metre six but with tremendous airtime. Pollard simply got under a full ball and freed his arms
Pollard nudges to square leg and sends a rushing Ramdin scurrying back, Ramdin was a goner had there been a direct hit at the bowler's end
hit to long on for a single that brings up the 50 stand off just 47 balls, a counterattack after the shambles at the top of the order
defended back to the bowler
pushed towards cover for a quick single
played from the crease towards point
short of a length and straight, defended from the crease
defended from the crease once again
width outside off stump and Ramdin steers it to third man
good length outside off stump, stays back and plays towards point
a fuller length just outside off, driven into the covers
played off the back foot towards point
good length angling into the off stump, Ramdin moves forward and blocks solidly
mid-on is in the circle so Ramdin gets on the front foot against a full ball and lofts through the line, clearing the fielder comfortably
cut off the back foot to point
that kept a bit low outside off stump, Pollard pushed it to point and they stole a quick single, the throw at the striker's end misses
length ball just outside off stump, defended back to the bowler
good length on a wicket to wicket line, defended on the leg side
tight line and length around off, Ramdin stays in his crease and plays to cover
shorter length at the body, Ramdin goes back and blocks this time
there's width on offer outside off, after four tight deliveries, and Ramdin goes back and cuts to deep point
played off the back foot towards long-on
the length is full, the line is wide. Pollard plants his foot forward and lofts over cover, hit with immense power
defended from the crease on the leg side
delicate from Pollard, moves forward, waits for the good length ball and opens the face to tickle it towards third man
Ramdin dabs towards point and hares down the pitch for a single, Pollard sends him back, the fielder at point had dived to his right to make the stop
pushed to wide mid-off and the single on offer is an easy one

a big appeal for lbw, but was there an inside edge? Umpire Kettleborough said not out right away. Ramdin was caught on the crease by one that nipped back into him and he was cramped for room as he tried to play across the line. There was an inside edge on to the pad
a bouncer and Pollard lets it pass
moves forward and across and then dabs the ball on the leg side
that is a m-o-n-s-t-r-o-u-s mow across the line and the ball is flying swiftly at the people in the stands beyond midwicket. He moved forward and across and just laid into a length ball, smashed it
the hammer blow is followed by a delicate dab in front of square leg
good length on a straighter line, played back to the bowler this time
bowled flat through the air on middle and off, Pollard stays in his crease and plays through midwicket
Ramdin gets on the front foot and defends the ball on the leg side, that was on a tight length on off stump
defended off the back foot on the leg side
Pollard gets to 50 with a six! He is well forward, he uses his long reach to get under the ball and then he frees his arms to hit through the line straight over the bowler's head
along the ground this time. The bowler responds to the six with a flat and short ball outside off stump. Pollard is back in a flash and drives it through covers. West Indies need less than 100 now
defended towards midwicket
a full ball on the pads, Ramdin turns it behind square for two more
a length ball outside off, cut off the back foot to point
short of a length with some lift outside off stump, Ramdin cuts and is beaten this time
defended from the crease on the off side
played off the back foot behind point
that was a loose shot, no where near a driveable length but Ramdin got forward and tried to hit it on the up, he was beaten
bowled full around off, Pollard meets it on the front foot and drives along the ground to long off
that's short and wide, I might have fancied a single off that. Ramdin goes back and slaps the ball hard through covers and into the gap on the boundary
played to point where there is a fumble from Rubel Hossain, the sub
defended back to the bowler
played off the pads on the leg side
hit hard off the back foot, but straight to the fielder at cover
driven off the front foot to point, the ball was fuller and around off
short and wide, the fielder at point does well to dive to his left and make a half stop. Ramdin had cut that hard
Pollard moves forward and well across his stumps to drive a length ball through square leg. He was outside off stump when he made contact
played from the crease towards point
nudged close towards midwicket for a single

that's a poor ball, fast and far down leg side, Pollard tries to glance and misses, Mushfiqur dives full length to his left and also misses. First extras of the innings and they bring up the century stand
nudged off the pads through square leg for a single
Ramdin brings up fifty by driving the ball off the back foot to long off, top innings under immense pressure

there's a deep midwicket in place but that is not a factor in Pollard's mind, he has room to free his arms and so he gets down on one knee and smacks the ball from outside off flat and far over the boundary
pushed towards long on for a single
played into the covers for one more

goes around the wicket and bowls one flat across Pollard, who goes back and punches the ball hard but in the air just wide of the bowler, who dives to his left in vain. Once the ball beats the bowler though, it is timed well enough to speed to the straight boundary
defended on the front foot
Ramdin has a whiff at this length ball outside off but is late on it
times a drive square off the wicket through the off side for a couple
once again beautifully timed by Ramdin through the same region, but this time is held to just the single
and he begins with a length ball on middle and leg which is whipped away by Pollard to the leg side
short of a length and angling into Pollard as he gets onto his toes to work this one away just behind square on the off side
short one again from Taskin as Pollard is content to let this one through to the keeper

Gazi gives this one plenty of air, Ramdin leans into the drive and caresses it past extra cover, the fielder gives chase even as the ball slows down near the ropes, the batsmen run well and get back for the third run
floated once more, this time on middle, as Pollard defends this one back to the bowler

manages to get an outside edge as Pollard looked to turn this away leg side, but the ball doesn't carry all the way to Nasir Hossain, stationed at first slip, who makes a desperate dive but just can't get his fingers under it. Close call there for Pollard
flatter and just outside off, Pollard makes room and cuts it straight to the fielder at point
Pollard gets behind this one going down the pads quite comfortably
Gazi gives this one more air as this one is eased down towards long on for a single
too short from Taskin as Pollard rocks back to pull this one fiercely to deep midwicket
short and wide and Ramdin looks to cut this away, but instead finds the fielder at point
again short and wide outside off and Ramdin makes him pay as he ramps this behind square to the third man boundary
fuller length this time, outside off, as Ramdin hammers this away to mid on for one
in the blockhole almost as Pollard is able to eke this out to find a single down to long on
wide outside off as Ramdin is able to glide this down to third man for a couple
Gazi tosses one on off, driven down towards long on for a single
floats one outside off as Ramdin is tempted into lofting this one over the off side, slicing this one behind square and over point. Manages to pick up three useful runs
Pollard straightaway onto the back foot to ease this down to deep midwicket
gets deep into his crease to create room on the off side to cut away Gazi in front of point to the square boundary. Excellent shot that from Ramdin
once again afforded room on the off side to cut away, but this time Mortaza is stationed at cover to cut off the boundary

and Sohag gets a much-deserved reward as Ramdin, looking to create room once more, is unable to find the space needed and ends up playing on to the base of his off stump. Ends a terrific fightback from the West Indian wicketkeeper, whose 145-run partnership with Pollard has helped change the nature of this contest
on a good length and just outside off, Pollard works it in front of square on the leg side for a single
straying on the pads, and that too full, as Holder gets off the mark with a gentle clip through midwicket
short of a length and jagging back in sharply, Holder looks to flick and misses. The ball rolls away past the keeper for a leg bye
Pollard once again strides forward before tucking away Al-Amin to the leg side for one
shortish length outside off which Holder gets on top off before working it down to third man for a single
length ball slipping down the leg side as Pollard is able to glance a single behind square
this is just too easy for Pollard as a nicely tossed up delivery is smashed down the ground over long on for yet another six. He hardly seem to hit that one, yet it just sailed over the rope
on the back foot this time as this is eased away down to long on
once again Gazi succeeds in getting an edge just outside off, and once again it falls short off Nasir, who just gets to it after the bounce
gets to the pitch of this well flighted delivery and drives it against the spin. The fielder at mid off gives chase and is able to stop the ball with his boots, saving a run for his team
nicely played by Holder, gets to the pitch of a well flighted delivery and drives it against the spin, the fielder at mid-off gives chase and stops the ball with his boots, saving a run for his team

runs are just leaking now for Bangladesh as Pollard this time shows some finesse by gliding Sohag through the vacant third man region, but doesn't quite get enough on it for it to reach the boundary. Still a very expensive over, as West Indies look to finish this in a hurry
on a good length and just outside off, Pollard comes down the track and drives it to long on, brings up WI's 200 as well
rocks onto the back foot to this shorter one from Al-Amin, finding the man at deep square leg

and Pollard's whirlwind innings comes to an end as he looks to clobber yet another one over the long on boundary, but doesn't quite time this one as well as the others before, with this one going very high into the air, before returning down, with Mahmudullah making an excellent diving catch
Holder more than content to see this one out from the bowler
length just outside off which Holder is able to squirt away on the off side for a quick single
goes round the wicket to the left-handed Narine as he allows this one to go through to the keeper
shortish length from Mortaza which Holder gets behind comfortably

uppish drive from Holder through the covers as he is lucky to avoid any fielders as this races to the boundary. There was definitely a shout for catch in there, but the placement was good enough to get it through
this time Holder strides out to drive this straight to mid off for a quick single, making his ground in the nick of time before the throw
Narine watches this one carefully from Mortaza before defending it back to the bowler
length ball on the pads which Narine is able to tuck away through the vacant space in midwicket for a brace. Gets off the mark as a result as well
Narine content to defend this one with a straight bat to see the over to an end
with no slips in place Holder simply glides this one to the fielder at third man
short ball from Al-Amin which has Narine playing an awkward pull shot which spoons into the air behind square, but luckily evades any fielders nearby

this is just majestic from Holder as he gets into a good position to this length ball on middle and off, playing the short-arm pull to good effect, with the ball landing just inside the boundary for four
Holder, looking to drive through extra-cover, instead succeeds in getting an outside edge which streaks away to the third man boundary to give West Indies an opening win in the series.
